# idsec_pcloud_target_platform (Resource)

pCloud target platform resource, manages pCloud target platform import.

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `platform_zip_path` (String) Local path to the platform zip file

### Optional

- `active` (Boolean) Indicates whether a platform is active or inactive
- `allowed_safes` (String) Regex of safes in which accounts from this platform can be managed
- `credentials_management_policy` (Attributes) CPM Policy (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--credentials_management_policy))
- `id` (Number) Unique numeric ID of the platform
- `name` (String) The display name of the platform
- `platform_id` (String) Unique string ID of the platform
- `privileged_access_workflows` (Attributes) Workflows configuration (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--privileged_access_workflows))
- `privileged_session_management` (Attributes) PSM Management (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--privileged_session_management))
- `system_type` (String) The type of system associated with the target

<a id="nestedatt--credentials_management_policy"></a>
### Nested Schema for `credentials_management_policy`

Optional:

- `change` (Attributes) Change policy (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--credentials_management_policy--change))
- `reconcile` (Attributes) Reconcile policy (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--credentials_management_policy--reconcile))
- `secret_update_configuration` (Attributes) Secret update configuration (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--credentials_management_policy--secret_update_configuration))
- `verification` (Attributes) Verification policy (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--credentials_management_policy--verification))

<a id="nestedatt--credentials_management_policy--change"></a>
### Nested Schema for `credentials_management_policy.change`

Optional:

- `allow_manual` (Boolean) Indicates whether an immediate change process can be initiated manually
- `auto_on_add` (Boolean) Indicates whether accounts related to this platform will be changed after being added
- `is_require_password_every_x_days_an_exception` (Boolean) Indicates whether the number of days between each periodic change is an exception to the master policy
- `perform_automatic` (Boolean) Indicates whether accounts related to this platform will be changed automatically
- `require_password_every_x_days` (Number) The number of days between each periodic change


<a id="nestedatt--credentials_management_policy--reconcile"></a>
### Nested Schema for `credentials_management_policy.reconcile`

Optional:

- `allow_manual` (Boolean) Indicates whether an immediate reconcile process can be initiated manually
- `automatic_reconcile_when_unsynced` (Boolean) Indicates whether or not passwords will be reconciled automatically after the CPM detects a password on a remote machine that is not synchronized with its corresponding password in the Server


<a id="nestedatt--credentials_management_policy--secret_update_configuration"></a>
### Nested Schema for `credentials_management_policy.secret_update_configuration`

Optional:

- `change_password_in_reset_mode` (Boolean) Defines whether or not password changes will be performed via reset mode using the reconciliation account. This is useful in cases where the password policy prevents the user from changing his own password or when a password minimal age restriction is applied


<a id="nestedatt--credentials_management_policy--verification"></a>
### Nested Schema for `credentials_management_policy.verification`

Optional:

- `allow_manual` (Boolean) Indicates whether an immediate change process can be initiated manually
- `auto_on_add` (Boolean) Indicates whether accounts related to this platform will be changed after being added
- `is_require_password_every_x_days_an_exception` (Boolean) Indicates whether the number of days between each periodic change is an exception to the master policy
- `perform_automatic` (Boolean) Indicates whether accounts related to this platform will be changed automatically
- `require_password_every_x_days` (Number) The number of days between each periodic change
